00028 /*
00029  * Field line types deduced by Lgm_Trace()
00030  */
00031 #define     LGM_OPEN_IMF                   0
00032 #define     LGM_CLOSED                     1
00033 #define     LGM_OPEN_N_LOBE                2
00034 #define     LGM_OPEN_S_LOBE                3
00035 #define     LGM_INSIDE_EARTH              -1
00036 #define     LGM_TARGET_HEIGHT_UNREACHABLE -2
00037 
00038 
00039 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX    9
00040 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_IMAX    (LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX+1)
00041 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX    (LGM_MAGSTEP_KMAX+2)
00042 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_REDMAX  1.0e-5
00043 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_REDMIN  0.7
00044 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_SCLMAX  0.1
00045 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_SAFE1   0.25
00046 #define     LGM_MAGSTEP_SAFE2   0.70
00047 
00048 #define     DQAGS   0   // Quadpack routine (works well for I. Dont use for Sb)
00049 #define     DQAGP   1   // Quadpack routine (works well for Sb. Overkill for I)
00050 #define     DQK21   2   // Quadpack simple routine (not terribly accurate).
00051 
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * these are used in B_FromScatteredData()
00055  * They control which interpolation scheme to use.
00056  * QUADRATIC_DFI doesnt seem to work very well...
00057  * The best is probably LINEAR_DFI
00058  */
00059 #define LINEAR          0
00060 #define LINEAR_DFI      1
00061 #define QUADRATIC       2
00062 #define QUADRATIC_DFI   3
00063 #define NEWTON_INTERP   4
00064 
00065 #define LGM_CDIP        0
00066 #define LGM_EDIP        1
00067 #define LGM_IGRF        2
00068 
00069 #define LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS 10000
00070 
00071 #define LGM_RELATIVE_JUMP_METHOD 0
00072 #define LGM_ABSOLUTE_JUMP_METHOD 1
00073 
00074 
00075 typedef struct Lgm_MagModelInfo {
00076 
00077     Lgm_CTrans  *c;                 /* This contains all time info and a bunch more stuff */
00078     long int    nFunc;
00079     int         (*Bfield)();
00080     int         SavePoints;
00081     double      Hmax;
00082     FILE        *fp;
00083     double      W[6];
00084     int         Kp;
00085     double      Dst;
00086     double      P;
00087     double      Bx, By, Bz;
00088     double      T96MOD_V[11];       /* free params for T96_MOD */
00089 
00090     double      Trace_s;
00091 
00092     double      B0, B1, B2;             // params for simplified mead field
00093 
00094 
00095     /*
00096      * Variable to control which internal model to use
00097      */
00098     int         InternalModel;          // Can be LGM_CDIP, LGM_EDIP or LGM_IGRF
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102     /*
00103      * Stuff that may be neeeded for field integrals, etc.
00104      */
00105     double              KineticEnergy;  // Particle kinetic energy
00106     double              Mass;           // Particle mass
00107     double              PitchAngle;     // Particle Pitch Angle
00108 
00109     Lgm_Vector          Pm_South;
00110     Lgm_Vector          Pm_North;
00111     double              Bm, Sm_South, Sm_North, Blocal;
00112     int                 FirstCall;
00113 //    double              epsabs, epsrel;
00114 
00115     /*
00116      * Arrays containing FL vals
00117      */
00118     double              s[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS];    // distance along FL
00119     double              Px[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS];   // Px along FL  (in GSM)
00120     double              Py[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS];   // Py along FL  (in GSM)
00121     double              Pz[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS];   // Pz along FL  (in GSM)
00122     Lgm_Vector          Bvec[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS]; // 3D B-field vector   (in GSM)
00123     double              Bmag[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS]; // magnitude of B
00124     double              BminusBcdip[LGM_MAX_INTERP_PNTS]; // magnitude of B minus magnitude of Cent. Dipole
00125     int                 nPnts;      // actual number of points defined
00126     double              ds;         // spacing in s (dist. along FL)
00127                                     // this will help in seacrhing the 
00128                                     // arrays (e.g. for interpolation).
00129     double              smin;       // location of Bmin
00130     double              Bmin;       // value of Bmin
00131     Lgm_Vector          Bvecmin;    // value of Bvecmin
00132     Lgm_Vector          Pmin;       // location of Bmin (in GSM)
00133     double              d2B_ds2;    // second derivative of B wrt to s at smin.
00134     double              Sb0;        // value of Sb integral for eq. mirroring particles.
00135     int                 imin1;      // imin1 and imin2 are the indices in the
00136     int                 imin2;      //   array between which smin is located.
00137 
00138     /*
00139      *  GSL defs for spline interpolation
00140      */
00141     gsl_interp_accel    *acc;       // accelerator
00142     gsl_interp_accel    *accPx;     // accelerator
00143     gsl_interp_accel    *accPy;     // accelerator
00144     gsl_interp_accel    *accPz;     // accelerator
00145     gsl_spline          *spline;    // spline object
00146     gsl_spline          *splinePx;  // spline object
00147     gsl_spline          *splinePy;  // spline object
00148     gsl_spline          *splinePz;  // spline object
00149     
00150 
00151 
00152     /*
00153      *  Other stuff
00154      */
00155     int                 VerbosityLevel;
00156     int                 UseInterpRoutines; // whether to use fast I and Sb routines.
00157 
00158 
00159     /*
00160      *  These variables are needed to make Lgm_MagStep() reentrant/thread-safe.
00161      *  They basically used to be static declarations within Lgm_MagStep()
00162      */
00163     double  Lgm_MagStep_eps_old;
00164     int     Lgm_MagStep_FirstTimeThrough;
00165     int     Lgm_MagStep_kmax;
00166     int     Lgm_MagStep_kopt;
00167     double  Lgm_MagStep_snew;
00168     double  Lgm_MagStep_A[LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX+1];
00169     double  Lgm_MagStep_alpha[LGM_MAGSTEP_IMAX+1][LGM_MAGSTEP_IMAX+1];
00170     double  Lgm_MagStep_d[LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX][LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX];
00171     double  Lgm_MagStep_x[LGM_MAGSTEP_JMAX];
00172 
00173 
00174     /*
00175      *  These variables are needed to make I_integrand() reentrant/thread-safe.
00176      *  They basically used to be static declarations.
00177      */

00179     int         Lgm_I_integrand_JumpMethod;
00180     double      Lgm_I_integrand_S;
00181     Lgm_Vector  Lgm_I_integrand_P;
00182     Lgm_Vector  Lgm_I_integrand_u_scale;
00183     int         Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls;
00184     int         Lgm_I_Integrator;
00185     double      Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel;
00186     double      Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs;
00187 
00188     /*
00189      *  These variables are needed to make Sb_integrand() reentrant/thread-safe.
00190      *  They basically used to be static declarations.
00191      */

00194     Lgm_Vector  Lgm_Sb_integrand_P;
00195     Lgm_Vector  Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale;

00197     int         Lgm_Sb_Integrator;              // This variable is not currently used (for now I force
00198                                                 // Sb to use DQAGP. )
00199     double      Lgm_Sb_Integrator_epsrel;

00201 
00202

00204      * Variables to control MagFlux integration

00207                                                 // MagFlux to use DQAGS. )

00209     double      Lgm_MagFlux_Integrator_epsabs;

00231      * Variables for defining Octree stuff

00234     int             Octree_kNN_k;
